alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 8:05AM CDT until June 09 at 9:25AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County. For the Cottonwood River...including Florence, Cottonwood Falls, Plymouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Highway 177 floods between Strong City and Cottonwood Falls. Flood waters spread out on the south side of Strong City impacting First Street and crossing over Highway 177. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:25 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 12.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Cottonwood River Cottonwood Fall 9.0 7.7 Sun 7 am CDT 11.3 12.5 10.2 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
